T1003.name: OS Credential Dumping
T1003.description: Adversaries attempt to dump credentials to obtain account login and credential material, normally in the form of a hash or a clear-text password, from the operating system and software.

T1059.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
T1059.description: Adversaries abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries.

T1190.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
T1190.description: Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing application (e.g., web server) to gain initial access.

T1486.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
T1486.description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network to interrupt availability to system and network resources.
